post.description:
Push Ancillary charge files to PointClickCare. Both Facility level and EMC level files can be posted using this API. Once the file has been pushed, the GET AncillaryChargesStatus API can be called to determine whether the File has been processed and is visible to Customers.

NOTE: Customer organizations work with PointClickCare to define Ancillary charge templates. For a successful upload, you must ask Facility/Organization staff to provide the template file name format and extension, and a copy of the associated specification. You will need to name and structure your file accordingly. Please also ensure the organization has enabled the Auto Imports Transactions at the EMC level. The posted file will be visible to customers within 5 minutes of you receiving a 201 Created response, however, the actual file processing time may vary.

In Sandbox environments, files must be named with the prefix 'ancillary_', and the extention '.txt', with the full filename and extention not exceeding 32 characters. E.g. ancillary_myfilename.txt.

data.description: Users are expected to upload ancillary-charges file of max size 10MB with pre-configured file format.

parameters.name: orgUuid
parameters.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for the organization.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: The type of media being sent through the request. Expected content-type header is "multipart/form-data".

x-authorization.name: two-legged-or-three-legged

get.description: Retrieve historical functional status assessment questions and responses for a patient completed in the past 30 days.

parameters.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a patient within the organization.</br></br>When a patient is admitted to a facility within an organization, they are assigned a patientId which is unique to their stay within that facility. If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. The patientId however is unique at the organization level. That is, no two patients across different facilities within the organization will have the same patientId.
parameters.name: patientId

parameters.description: Represents the start of the date range for which the ADL assessment was recorded will be returned for a patient. The date should be expressed in the following format: YYYY-MM-DD. If startDate and endDate are not specified, only the latest assessment responses will be returned from the last 30 days. startDate can be no more than 30 days before the current date.
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: Represents the end of the date range for which the ADL assessment was recorded will be returned for a patient. The date should be expressed in the following format: YYYY-MM-DD. If startDate and endDate are not specified, only the latest assessment responses will be returned from the last 30 days.
parameters.name: endDate

get.description:
Retrieve a list of admit, transfer and discharge (ADT) record entries for a patient.

ADT entries include actions such as admission, discharge, internal room transfer, death, leave of absence.

Changes made to the patient's primary payer details are also retrieved.

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of ADTs to retrieve. This represents PointClickCare's unique identifier for the patient's ADT record within the organization. If adtRecordIds is provided then patientId, effectiveDate, and pageSize should not be provided.
parameters.name: adtRecordIds

parameters.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a facility within the organization. If adtRecordIds is provided then facId must be provided.
parameters.name: facId

parameters.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a patient within the organization.</br></br>When a patient is admitted to a facility within an organization, they are assigned a patientId which is unique to their stay within that facility. If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. The patientId however is unique at the organization level. That is, no two patients across different facilities within the organization will have the same patientId. If adtRecordIds is provided, then patientId should not be provided. Otherwise, patientId should be provided.
parameters.name: patientId

parameters.description:
Represents the date when the ADT records became effective. If adtRecordIds is provided, then effectiveDate should not be provided. Otherwise, effectiveDate is optional.

The expected date format is YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.description: Possible values are active, cancelled, all. The default response will only be active ADT records.

get.description:
Retrieve the list of advance directives for a patient. Advance directives allow a patient to spell out their decisions about end of life care ahead of time.

In PointClickCare, facilities are required to create an order template for consent, which is then used to add and track advanced directives for a patient. The consent template can contain one or multiple advance directives.

parameters.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a patient within the organization.</br></br>When a patient is admitted to a facility within an organization, they are assigned a patientId which is unique to their stay within that facility. If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. The patientId however is unique at the organization level. That is, no two patients across different facilities within the organization will have the same patientId.

parameters.description: Represents the status of the consent. Acceptable values are "active", "discontinued" and "pending". Multiple comma separated values are accepted. If no value is passed, only 'active' records are returned.

get.description: Retrieves a list of assessments from the patient chart. This API includes both standard and custom assessments.

parameters.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a patient within the organization.</br></br>When a patient is admitted to a facility within an organization, they are assigned a patientId which is unique to their stay within that facility. If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. The patientId however is unique at the organization level. That is, no two patients across different facilities within the organization will have the same patientId.
parameters.name: patientId

parameters.description: The status of the assessment. Acceptable values are "All, Complete, Errors, In Progress, Inactivated, Incomplete, Modified". Multiple comma separated values are accepted. If no value is passed only completed records are returned.
parameters.name: assessmentStatus

parameters.description: Unique template identifier associated with custom assessment.
parameters.name: templateId

parameters.description: Identifies the template version of all assessments, this includes both system-defined and custom assessments.
parameters.name: templateVersion

parameters.description: Unique template identifier for system-defined assessment.
parameters.name: systemTemplateId

parameters.description: The start of the date range for which assessments will be returned for a patient. The date and time should be expressed in UTC in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ. If startDate is not specified it will default to January 1, 1970 UTC. If both startDate and endDate are not specified then the last 30 days of assessments will be returned. If the latestTemplateVersion parameter is set to true it will take precedence over startDate and endDate and only the most recently created assessment for each unique templateId will be returned.
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: The end of the date range for which assessments will be returned for a patient. The date and time should be expressed in UTC in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ. If endDate is not specified it will default to the current date and time. If both startDate and endDate are not specified then the last 30 days of assessments will be returned. If the latestTemplateVersion parameter is set to true it will take precedence over startDate and endDate and only the most recently created assessment for each unique templateId will be returned.
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: When set to true this will take precedence over startDate and endDate and only the most recently created assessment for each unique template id will be returned. This parameter will default to false if not provided.
parameters.name: latestTemplateVersion

parameters.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a patient within the organization.</br></br>When a patient is admitted to a facility within an organization, they are assigned a patientId which is unique to their stay within that facility. If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. The patientId however is unique at the organization level. That is, no two patients across different facilities within the organization will have the same patientId.
parameters.name: patientId

parameters.description: Type of report requested. Acceptable values are 'laboratory' or 'radiology'.
parameters.name: reportType

parameters.description: The status of the report to return. Return multiple statuses by separating them with a comma. The default is COMPLETED when the 'status' query parameter is not provided. Options are: ALL, COMPLETED, RESULTED, and CANCELLED. Using ALL will return results with a status of COMPLETED, RESULTED, and CANCELLED.
parameters.name: status

parameters.description:
issuedDateTime=ge (where ge is greater than or equal to) Represents the start of the date range during which the report was created. The date and time should be expressed in UTC in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ. For example if issuedDateTime=ge2015-08-12T05:23:45.000Z the range will include any time after and including 2015-08-12T05:23:45.000Z. If the 'issuedDateTime' parameter is not passed, all records will be returned till the current date.

issuedDateTime=le (where le is less than or equal to) Represents the end of the date range during which the report was created. The date and time should be expressed in UTC in the following format: the immunization record for a particular immunization was created. The date and time should be expressed in UTC in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ. For example if issuedDateTime=le2015-08-12T05:23:45.000Z the range will include any time prior to and including 2015-08-12T05:23:45.000Z. If the 'issuedDateTime' parameter is not passed, all records will be returned till the current date.
parameters.name: issuedDateTime

get.description: Retrieve a list of immunization and vaccine records for a patient.</br></br>In PointClickCare, an immunization record is added when a patient's consent is obtained for the immunization, if the patient is eligible for the immunization. The immunization record is then updated when the immunization is administered. For certain types of immunizations, the immunization record is also updated with the results information for the immunization after it has been administered.

parameters.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a patient within the organization.</br></br>When a patient is admitted to a facility within an organization, they are assigned a patientId which is unique to their stay within that facility. If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. The patientId however is unique at the organization level. That is, no two patients across different facilities within the organization will have the same patientId.
parameters.name: patientId

parameters.description: Part of pagination control. Skip (page - 1) * pageSize records from the beginning of the list before returning the rest. Default is 1.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Part of pagination control. How many records to return in response to this request. Default is 50. Maximum value allowed is 200.
parameters.name: pageSize

parameters.description: Represents if an immunization was administered or not. Field can be set to 'true', 'false' or left blank.
parameters.name: given

parameters.description:
createdDateTime=ge (where ge is greater than or equal to) Represents the start of the date range during which the immunization record for a particular immunization was created. The date and time should be expressed in UTC in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ. For example if createdDateTime=ge2015-08-12T05:23:45.000Z the range will include any time after and including 2015-08-12T05:23:45.000Z. If the 'createdDateTime' parameter is not passed, all records will be returned till the current date.

createdDateTime=le (where le is less than or equal to) Represents the end of a range of dates during which the immunization record for a particular immunization was created. The date and time should be expressed in UTC in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ. For example if createdDateTime=le2015-08-12T05:23:45.000Z the range will include any time prior to and including 2015-08-12T05:23:45.000Z. If the 'createdDateTime' parameter is not passed, all records will be returned till the current date.
parameters.name: createdDateTime

parameters.description:
administrationDateTime=ge (where ge is greater than or equal to) Represents the start of the date range during which immunizations were administered to a patient. The date and time should be expressed in UTC in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ. For example if administrationDateTime=ge2015-08-12T05:23:45.000Z the range will include any time after and including 2015-08-12T05:23:45.000Z. If the 'administrationDateTime' parameter is not passed, all records will be returned till the current date.

administrationDateTime=le (where le is less than or equal to) Represents the end of a range of dates during which immunizations were administered to a patient. The date and time should be expressed in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ. For example if administrationDateTime=le2015-08-12T05:23:45.000Z the range will include any time prior to and including 2015-08-12T05:23:45.000Z. If the 'administrationDateTime' parameter is not passed, all records will be returned till the current date.
parameters.name: administrationDateTime

If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. The patientId however is unique at the organization level. That is, no two patients across different facilities within the organization will have the same patientId.
parameters.name: patientId

parameters.description: Represents the start of the date range for which the observations will be returned for a patient. The date and time should be expressed in UTC in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ. If startDate and endDate are not specified, then the latest observations will be returned. If only startDate is not specified, January 1, 1970 UTC will be used as the start date. If the  "latest"  parameter is set to true, it will take precedence over startDate and endDate and the latest observations will be returned.
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: Represents the end of the date range for which the observations will be returned for a patient. The date and time should be expressed in UTC in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ. If startDate and endDate are not specified, then the latest observations will be returned. If only endDate is not specified, the current date and time (the time the request is made) will be used as the endDate. If the "latest" parameter is set to true, it will take precedence over startDate and endDate and the latest observations will be returned.
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: Indicate to only get the latest values. Accepted values: true or false. If set to true, this will take precedence over startDate and endDate and the latest observations will be returned. Value will be defaulted to be true if startDate and endDate are not specified.
parameters.name: latest

parameters.description: Represents the type of observation. Acceptable values are: heartrate, bloodPressure, bloodSugar, oxygenSaturation, weight, height, painLevel, temperature, respirations. post.description:
Push Private Cash Import files to PointClickCare. Both Facility level and EMC level files can be posted using this API. Once the file has been pushed, the GET PrivateCashStatus API can be called to determine whether the file has been processed and a correspondent Cash Batch is visible to Customers.

NOTE: Customer organizations work with PointClickCare to define Private Import Configurations. For a successful upload, you must ask Facility/Organization staff to provide information for the configuration designated for this API. This information includes the file format specification associated with the configuration as well as the file name format, prefix and extension. The full filename and extension should not exceed 32 characters.

A 201 response will be sent upon receiving the file, however, the actual file processing time may vary.

data.description:
Users are expected to upload private-cash-import file of max size 10MB with pre-configured file format, according to the Private Import specifications provided.

File Name

  • String - 32 characters max
  • Format: prefix****.extension. The prefix can be a max of 20 characters and the extension can be a max of 3 characters

get.description: Retrieves list of all progress notes and their associated Id, for the last 30 days for a patient.

parameters.description:
PointClickCare's unique identifier for a patient within the organization.
When a patient is admitted to a facility within an organization, they are assigned a patientId which is unique to their stay within that facility. If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. The patientId however is unique at the organization level. That is, no two patients across different facilities within the organization will have the same patientId.
parameters.name: patientId

parameters.description: Represents the start of the date range for which the progress notes were recorded will be returned for a patient. The date should be expressed in the following format: YYYY-MM-DD. If startDate and endDate are not specified, the last 30 days of progress notes will be returned as default. If only startDate is specified, up to the next 30 days of progress notes after startDate will be returned. Maximum range is 30 days, including endDate (e.g. 2020-01-01 to 2020-01-30 is ok, but to 2020-01-31 is not).
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: Represents the end of the date range for which the progress notes were recorded will be returned for a patient. The date should be expressed in the following format: YYYY-MM-DD. If startDate and endDate are not specified, the last 30 days of progress notes will be returned as default. If only endDate is specified, 30 days of progress notes before endDate will be returned.
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: Part of pagination control. Skip (page - 1) * pageSize records from the beginning of the list before returning the rest. Default is 1.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Part of pagination control. How many records to return in response to this request. Default is 50. Maximum value allowed is 200.
parameters.name: pageSize

accessingEntityId.description:
PointClickCare's unique identifier for an external organization with a signed data sharing agreement.

Note: Currently limited to hospitals participating in data exchange with PointClickCare.

actionCode.description: Represents the short code associated to the action type for the ADT record. PointClickCare allows facilities to configure a value for the action code up to 5 characters long.

actionType.description: Represents the action type associated to the ADT record. The action types are configurable at a facility level in PointClickCare. This means that the value of this field may vary from facility to facility. Each facility defined action type is mapped to a standard action type however.

additionalBedId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a bed within a facility.

additionalFloorId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a floor within a facility.

additionalRoomId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a room within a facility.

additionalUnitId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a unit within a facility.

admissionSource.description: Represents the source of admission (physician referral, transfer), if available. The values that a user can select for source of admission are configurable at a facility level in PointClickCare.

admissionSourceCode.description: Represents a short description code for the source of admission. When configuring the values for the admission source, facilities have the option to include a short code/short description for the admission source as well.

admissionType.description: Represents the type of admission (for e.g. Emergency, Elective, Urgent) associated with the admission action, if available. The values that a user can select for admission type are configurable at a facility level in PointClickCare.

admissionTypeCode.description: Represents a short description code for the type of admission. When configuring the values for the admission type, facilities have the option to include a short code/short description for the admission type as well.

adtRecordId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for the patient's ADT record within the organization.

bedId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a bed within a facility.

destination.description: Represents the name of the care setting or facility where the patient is going to, if available. This field is only returned for ADT records where the Standard Action Type is one of 'Internal Transfer', 'Discharge' or 'Leave'.

destinationType.description: Represents the type of the care setting or facility where the patient is going to, if available. For e.g. Funeral home, Home. This field is only returned for ADT records where the Standard Action Type is one of 'Death', 'Discharge' or 'Leave'.

dischargeStatus.description: Represents the status of discharge, if available. For e.g. Discharged/Transferred to another hospital or Discharged/Transferred to a Long Term Care hospital. The values that a user can select for discharge status are configurable at a facility level in PointClickCare.

dischargeStatusCode.description: Represents the code associated with the status of discharge, if available.

effectiveDateTime.description: Represents the date when the ADT record became effective. PointClickCare allows users to modify historical ADT records for a patient. As a result, users are able to modify the effective time for the ADT record. However, effective date for an existing ADT record cannot be modified. Users can also delete an existing ADT record. The date and time should be expressed in UTC in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ.

enteredBy.description: The user who entered the ADT.

enteredByPositionId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier position of the user who entered the ADT.

enteredDate.description: The date and time the ADT was created. It is expressed in UTC in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ.

floorId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a floor within a facility.

modifiedDateTime.description: Represents the date when the ADT record was last updated in PointClickCare. PointClickCare allows users to modify historical ADT records for a patient, as well as add future dated ADT records. The date and time should be expressed in UTC in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ.

origin.description: Represents the name of the care setting or facility where the patient came from, if available. This field is only returned for ADT records where the Standard Action Type is one of 'Return From Leave', 'Admission' or 'Room Reserve'.

originType.description: Represents the type of care setting or facility where the patient came from, if available. For e.g. Acute care hospital, Hospice or Rehab hospital. This field is only applicable for ADT records where the Standard Action Type is one of 'Return From Leave', 'Admission' or 'Room Reserve'.

outpatient.description: Represents whether if the patient is an outpatient. Possible responses are 'true' or 'false'.

outpatientStatus.description: Represents the outpatient status for the patient for the ADT Record. Possible values are 'active' or 'inactive'. The field is only returned if the patient is an outpatient.

patientId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a patient within the organization.</br></br>When a patient is admitted to a facility within an organization, they are assigned a patientId which is unique to their stay within that facility. If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. The patientId however is unique at the organization level. That is, no two patients across different facilities within the organization will have the same patientId.

payerCode.description: Represents the payer code for the primary payer name. Payer code is 3-character free-form short code. PointClickCare allows facilities to configure a payer code for each payer that gets added to the system.

payerType.description:
Represents the patient's primary payer's type. Possible values for this field are:

  • managedCare
  • medicaid
  • medicareA
  • medicareB
  • medicareD
  • other
  • outpatient
  • private

qhsWaiver.description: Flag represents whether the patient has the 3-day requirement waived for hospital discharge. If 'true', patient has the 3-day requirement waived for the following census events: 'Admission', 'Internal Transfer', and 'Return from Leave'.

roomId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a room within a facility.

skilledCare.description: Indicates whether skilled care was required for the patient during the current stay at the LTPAC facility.

skilledEffectiveFromDate.description: Indicates date from which Skilled Care was provided to the patient

skilledEffectiveToDate.description: Indicates date till which Skilled Care was provided to the patient

standardActionType.description:
Represents the standard action type associated to the action type. PointClickCare allows facilities to define custom action types. Each custom action type is mapped to a standard action type. Possible values for this field are:
  • Admission
  • Death
  • Discharge
  • Internal Transfer
  • Leave
  • Return from Leave
  • Room Reserve

stopBillingDate.description: Represents the financial move-out date of a resident.  For example, a resident is discharged on June 10th (effective date), but they will be billed for the room until the end of the month - June 30th (stop billing Date).

transferReason.description: The documented reason for transfer as captured in the patient census. If the user selects a reason for transfer type of 'Other', the text entered in the Other field is returned.

unitId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a unit within a facility.

isCancelledRecord.description: Indicates whether an ADT record event is cancelled or not.

data.dischargeStatus: Discharged to home or self care

data.description: List of patient's ADT records.

adlScoreDate.description: The date when the daily ADL score was generated in PointClickCare. The date is expressed in the following format: YYYY-MM-DD.

modifiedBy.description: The user who edited the ADL score at the facility.

modifiedDateTime.description: The date when the ADL score was manually edited by a user at the facility. PointClickCare allows users to modify the daily ADL score for a patient. The date and time is expressed in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ.

unit.description: Represents the unit of the immunization that was administered to the patient, if recorded.

value.description: Represents the amount of the immunization administered to the patient, if recorded.

display.description: Text description of the route of administration.

system.description:
Type of coding system being used e.g. 'PointClickCare' or SNOMED. Can be a URL.
If both SNOMED and PointClickCare codes are passed, only the PointClickCare codes will be saved.
Supported systems are:
  • PointClickCare: https://pointclickcare.com/system/administration-route

  • SNOMED: http://snomed.info/sct The codes associated with the SNOMED system can be found at http://browser.ihtsdotools.org/?

confirmedBy.description: The person who confirmed the Administrative Order

createdBy.description: The person who created the Administrative Order

effectiveDate.description: Effective Date of the Administrative Order

inEffectiveDate.description: In Effective Date of the Administrative Order

orderVerified.description: 'Y' if the Administrative Order been verified

orderedBy.description: The person who ordered the Administrative Order

relationship.description: The type of Administrative Order. Ie. Hold, Resume, etc.

advanceDirectivesConsentId.description: PointClickCares unique identifier for the advance directives consents.

communicationMethod.description:
Represents the method used to communicate the consent order for the patient.
Possible values are Phone, Verbal, Prescriber written and 'Prescriber entered'.

consentStatus.description: Represents the validity for the consent. Possible values are 'Current and Verified', 'Supported By Healthcare Will', 'Verified With Family Only', 'Verified By Medical Record Only' and 'Supported By Durable Power of Attorney for Healthcare'.

description.description: Represents the description for the advance directive order.

directives.description:
Represents all the individual advance directives included in the consent order, if available. PointClickCare allows a consent order to be created without selecting any directives in the consent order.
Possible values for directives are:
  • Antibiotic Therapy
  • Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation
  • Intravenous Infusion
  • Intubation
  • Life Support
  • Other Directive
  • Resuscitation

discontinuedBy.description: Represents the PointClickCare user who discontinued the consent. This is typically the practitioner or medical professional assigned to the patient.

discontinuedById.description: Unique identifier for the practitioner or medical professional that ordered the consent to be discontinued.

discontinuedDate.description:
Represents the date when the consent was discontinued.
The date is expressed in UTC in the following format:YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ.

orderDate.description:
Represents the date when the consent was ordered.
The date is expressed in UTC in the following format:YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ.

orderedBy.description: Represents the PointClickCare user who ordered the consent. This is typically the practitioner or medical professional assigned to the patient.

orderedById.description: Unique identifier for the practitioner or medical professional that ordered the consent.

patientId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a patient within the organization.</br></br>When a patient is admitted to a facility within an organization, they are assigned a patientId which is unique to their stay within that facility. If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. The patientId however is unique at the organization level. That is, no two patients across different facilities within the organization will have the same patientId.

revisionDate.description: Represents the date when the consent was last updated. The date is expressed in UTC in the following format:YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ.

status.description:
Represents the status of the consent order for the patient. Possible values are "active", "discontinued" and "pending".
When a consent order is created for a patient and it is not signed, it is in the 'pending' state. After it has been signed, it becomes 'active'. If the advance directive is discontinued, it is in the 'discontinued' state.

data.description: Antibiotic Therapy & Resuscitation
Intubation & Life Support
Intravenous Infusion & Other Directive
List of advance directives consents.

allergenCode.description: Represents the applicable standard code of the allergen.

allergyIntoleranceId.description: The unique identifier for the allergy.

category.description: Represents the category the allergy falls under. Acceptable values are 'Drug', 'Food', 'Environmental', 'Substance' and 'Other'.

clinicalStatus.description: Represents the allergy status. Possible values are 'active', 'priorHistory' and 'resolved'.

createdBy.description: Represents the user that created the allergy.

createdDate.description: The recorded date the allergy and intolerance record was created. The date and time are expressed in UTC in the following format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ.

onsetDate.description: Represents the date when the allergy was identified. The date is expressed as YYYY-MM-DD.

patientId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a patient within the organization.</br></br>When a patient is admitted to a facility within an organization, they are assigned a patientId which is unique to their stay within that facility. If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. The patientId however is unique at the organization level. That is, no two patients across different facilities within the organization will have the same patientId.

reactionNote.description: Free text notes associated to the allergy entered by the user. Notes can be added at the time of adding an allergy or after an allergy has been added.

reactionSubType.description:
Represents the reaction sub type. Each reaction type can have its own sub type.
Reaction sub type for 'Anaphylaxis'
  • Bronchospasm
  • Hypotension
  • Laryngeal edema

Reaction sub type for 'Cutaneous reactions'
  • Contact sensitivity
  • Erythema multiforme
  • Erythema nodosum
  • Exfoliative dermatitis
  • Fixed drug eruption
  • Maculopapular (morbilliform) rash
  • Pruritus
  • Stevens-Johnson syndrome
  • Toxic epidermal necrolysis
  • Urticaria and angioedema
  • Vasculitis

Reaction sub type for 'Hepatic reactions'
  • Cholestatic reactions
  • Hepatocellular damage

Reaction sub type for 'Photosensitivity reactions'
  • Destruction of formed elements of blood
  • Hemolytic anemia
  • Neutropenia
  • Thrombocytopenia

Reaction sub type for 'Pulmonary reactions'
  • Edema
  • Fibrosis
  • Interstitial or alveolar pneumonitis

Reaction sub type for 'Renal reactions'
  • Glomerulonephritis
  • Interstitial nephritis
  • Nephrotic syndrome

reactionSubTypeCode.description: Represents the applicable standard code of the reaction sub type.

reactionType.description: Represents the reaction type. Acceptable values are 'Anaphylaxis', 'Cutaneous reactions', 'Drug Fever', 'Hepatic reactions', 'Lymphadenopathy', 'Nausea', 'Photosensitivity reactions', 'Pulmonary reactions', 'Renal reactions', 'Serum sickness', 'Systemic vasculitis'.

reactionTypeCode.description: Represents the applicable standard code of the reaction type.

resolvedDate.description: Represents the date when the allergy was resolved. The date is expressed as YYYY-MM-DD.

revisionBy.description: The recorded client/user name who last revised the allergy and intolerance record.

revisionDate.description: The recorded date the allergy and intolerance record was last revised. The date and time are expressed in UTC in the following format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ.

severity.description: Represents the severity of the allergy for the patient. Acceptable values are 'Mild', 'Moderate', 'Severe' and 'Unknown'. 'Unknown' is returned if no value for 'Severity' is selected when entering the allergy through the PointClickCare application.

type.description: Represents the allergy type. Possible values are 'Allergy', 'Intolerance' and 'Propensity to Adverse Reactions' or 'Unknown'. 'Type' was not always a required field in the PointClickCare application when adding an allergy. There may be existing older records where this value was not set. In those cases, a value of 'Unknown' will be returned.

data.description: List of allergies.

outliers.description: Represents if the patient has no known allergies or whether if the allergies for the patient are yet to be determined. Possible values are 'No Known Allergies' or 'To Be Determined'.

description.description: A description of the amenity within a facility.

id.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for the amenity.

AppFacility.description: all the facilities in which the application is activated. If the scope is 'Corporate', this array will be empty, but the application has been activated in all facilities. If the scope is 'Facility' but no facilityInfo is returned, the application is ready to be activated in facilities but has not been yet.

activationDate.description: Date when application was enabled in the facility.

facId.description: Facility in which the application is activated.

patientId.description:
PointClickCare's unique identifier for a patient within the organization.

When a patient is admitted to a facility within an organization, they are assigned a patientId which is unique to their stay within that facility. If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. The patientId however is unique at the organization level. That is, no two patients across different facilities within the organization will have the same patientId.

CommonPickListType.description:
Facility configured values.

PointClickCare provides the ability for facilities to create custom pick lists for common sets of reference data. They are used to show a list of items on the UI controls that the user can 'pick' from when entering data. For example, a facility is able to customize a marital status pick list such that when creating a patient the user may only pick from a list of approved values. The pick list values themselves are free-form text fields and at this time are not locale specific and case sensitivity is not important. There is no meaning associated with the ordering of the pick list values.

data.description:
List of facility configured values.

PointClickCare provides the ability for facilities to create custom pick lists for common sets of reference data. They are used to show a list of items on the UI controls that the user can 'pick' from when entering data. For example, a facility is able to customize a marital status pick list such that when creating a patient the user may only pick from a list of approved values. The pick list values themselves are free-form text fields and at this time are not locale specific and case sensitivity is not important. There is no meaning associated with the ordering of the pick list values.

Condition.description: Retrieve all conditions (problems and diagnosis) for a patient in PointClickCare.

classificationDescription.description: Represents the classification for the condition. Classifications are configurable at the facility level in PointClickCare.

clinicalStatus.description: Represents the clinical status of the condition. Possible values are 'ACTIVE' or 'RESOLVED'.

comments.description: Free text notes associated to the condition entered by the user. Notes can be added at the time of adding a condition or after a condition record has been added. Line breaks are represented by \n, carriage returns by \r and a combination of both is represented by \r\n. Backslashes in the text must be represented as \\\\.

conditionId.description: Unique identifier for the patient's condition.

conditionCode.description: Represents the applicable standard code of a patient's condition.

createdBy.description: Represents the PointClickCare user that created the condition record.

createdDate.description: The recorded date the condition record was created. The date and time are expressed in UTC in the following format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ.

icd10.description: Represents the ICD10 code for the condition.

onsetDate.description: Represents the date when the condition began. The date format is YYYY-MM-DD.

principalDiagnosis.description: If there is mapping in the PointClickCare System for the Principal diagnosis we will return a true response for the Principal Diagnosis and all others will return false

rankDescription.description: Represents the rank assigned to the condition. In PointClickCare, a patient can have only one active primary condition at a time. The ranks assigned to conditions can be created and are configurable at the facility level.

resolvedDate.description: Represents the date when the condition was resolved. The date format is YYYY-MM-DD.

revisionBy.description: The recorded client/user name who last revised the condition record.

revisionDate.description: The recorded date the condition record was last revised. The date and time are expressed in UTC in the following format YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ.

therapy.description: Represents if the condition is a therapy diagnosis. This field is disabled by default in PointClickCare. Facilities may choose to enable this field. If this field is disabled, this value is not returned. If this field is enabled, possible values that can be returned are 'true' or 'false'.

Condition.title: Condition

payerCode.description: Represents the payer code associated to the payer. PointClickCare allows up till 3 characters for this field.

payerCode2.description: Represents the second payer code associated to the payer, if available. This optional field allows the PointClickCare facilities to expand the payer code. For example, if they have multiple locations that use the same payer and they want to use the payer code to identify further.

payerId.description: PointClickCares unique identifier for the payer. The identifier is unique at the organization level.

payerName.description: Represents the name of the patients payer.

Represents the payers rank in the payer tree. Possible values are:
  • Primary
  • Secondary
  • Third
  • Forth
  • Fifth
  • Informational

payerType.description:
Represents the payer type for the payer. Possible values are:
  • managedCare
  • medicaid
  • medicareA
  • medicareB
  • medicareD
  • other
  • outpatient
  • private

pps.description: Represents if the payer follows Prospective Payment System (PPS) rules. Possible values are true or false.

coverageId.description: Unique identifier for the coverage record.

effectiveFromDateTime.description: Represents the date when the coverage came into effect. The date and time format are expressed in UTC in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ.

effectiveToDateTime.description: Represents the date when the coverage is effective till. The date and time format are expressed in UTC in the following format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ.

patientId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a patient within the organization.</br></br>When a patient is admitted to a facility within an organization, they are assigned a patientId which is unique to their stay within that facility. If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. The patientId however is unique at the organization level. That is, no two patients across different facilities within the organization will have the same patientId.

DiagnosticReportLaboratoryTestIdentifier.description:
Represents the lab test/panel performed.

Note: If a testset.identifier is being sent, identifier.code, identifier.system, and identifier.display are required.

code.description:
Specific code for the laboratory test.

Note: Limit of 50 characters
Note: If a testset.identifier is being sent, this field is required.
Note: Cannot be empty string.

display.description:
Text description of the laboratory tests. Note: Limit of 500 characters.

Note: If a testset.identifier is being sent, this field is required.
Note: Cannot be empty string.

system.description:
Type of coding system being used. Can be a URL. PCC recommends LOINC for laboratory tests.

LOINC: http://loinc.org

Note: Limit of 500 characters
Note: If a testset.identifier is being sent, this field is required.
Note: Cannot be empty string.

DiagnosticReportLaboratoryTestIdentifier.title: DiagnosticReportLaboratoryTestIdentifier

abnormalityCode.description:
Flag for any abnormality observed in lab test.

Possible values supported in PointClickCare:
  • BLANK- Normal
  • U - Significant change up
  • D - Significant change down
  • B - Better
  • W - Worse
  • I - Intermediate
  • MS - Moderately Susceptible
  • R - Resistant
  • S - Susceptible
  • VS - Very Susceptible
  • L - Below Low normal
  • H - Above High Normal
  • A - Abnormal - non numberic
  • LL - Below lower panic limits
  • HH - Above upper panic limits
  • AA - Very Abnormal - non numberic
  • < - Below lowest instrument scale
  • > - Above highest instrument scale

abnormalityComment.description:
Free text field to capture any additional abnormality comments associated with the lab test result.

Note: Limit of 250 characters.

referenceRange.description:
Represents the reference range for the lab test. Note: Limit of 100 characters.

Note: If a result is being sent, this field is required.
Note: Cannot be empty string.

DiagnosticReportLaboratoryValueQuantity.description:
Represents the unit and value for the observation.

Note: If a results.valueQuantity is being sent, valueQuantity.value and valueQuantity.unit are required.

unit.description:
Represents the unit of the value for the measured amount of the observation. Note: Limit of 60 characters.

Note: If a results.valueQuantity is being sent, this field is required.
Note: Cannot be empty string.

value.description:
Represents the measured amount of the result of the observation. Note: Limit of 200 characters.

Note: If a results.valueQuantity is being sent, this field is required.
Note: Cannot be empty string.

DiagnosticReportLaboratoryValueQuantity.title: DiagnosticReportLaboratoryValueQuantity

panelName.description: Represents the panel name. This field is only applicable to Laboratory reports.

code.description: Represents the code for the observation or procedure.

codeDescription.description: Represents the description of the code.

codeSystem.description: Represents the code system. For Laboratory reports, LOINC is used as a the code system. For Radiology reports, CPT is used as the code system.

comment.description: Notes/comments associated with the observation or procedure. Line breaks are represented by \n, carriage returns by \r and and a combination of both is represented by \r\n. Backslashes in the text must be represented as \\\\.

observationId.description: Represents the unique identifier for the observation. This field is only applicable to Laboratory reports.

observationName.description: Represents the observation name. This field is only applicable to Laboratory reports.

procedureName.description: Represents the procedure name. This field is only applicable to Radiology reports.

referenceRange.description: Represents the reference range for the observation. This field is only applicable to Laboratory reports.

resultStatus.description: Represents the status of the result for an observation or procedure. Possible values are 'Final' or 'Corrected'.

unitText.description: Represents the unit of the value for the measured amount of the observation. This field is only applicable to Laboratory reports.

value.description: Represents the measured amount of the result of the observation. This field is only applicable to Laboratory reports.

postalCode.description: Postal code for the external facility's contact.

patientId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a patient within the organization.When a patient is admitted to a facility within an organization, they are assigned a patientId which is unique to their stay within that facility. If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. The patientId however is unique at the organization level. That is, no two patients across different facilities within the organization will have the same patientId. If adtRecordIds is provided, then patientId should not be provided. Otherwise, patientId should be provided.

discipline.description:
Represents 2-letter code which indicates the type of therapy provided. Acceptable values are
PT Physical Therapy
OT Occupational Therapy
ST Speech/Audiology Pathology
RP Respiratory Therapy
PS Psychological Therapy
RT Recreational Therapy

typeOfMinutes.description:
Represents a 1-letter code which indicates the context or setting of the therapy session. Acceptable values are
E Evaluation
I Individual
C Concurrent
G Group
O Co-treatment minutes

keyDate.description: The Key Date refers to the specific date when the therapy session took place for a patient (denoted as A0 for actual or P0 for planned). This date serves as a reference point for each set of therapy minutes recorded as actual or planned for the patient.The expected date format is YYYY-MM-DD.

therapyMinutes.description:
Object containing actual and planned discrete therapy minutes recorded.The therapyMinutes object should include the following keys
KeyTypeDescription
A10 Integer Actual minutes of therapy recorded 10 calendar days before the Key Date.
A9 Integer Actual minutes of therapy recorded 9 calendar days before the Key Date.
A8 Integer Actual minutes of therapy recorded 8 calendar days before the Key Date.
A7 Integer Actual minutes of therapy recorded 7 calendar days before the Key Date.
A6 Integer Actual minutes of therapy recorded 6 calendar days before the Key Date.
A5 Integer Actual minutes of therapy recorded 5 calendar days before the Key Date.
A4 Integer Actual minutes of therapy recorded 4 calendar days before the Key Date.
A3 Integer Actual minutes of therapy recorded 3 calendar days before the Key Date.
A2 Integer Actual minutes of therapy recorded 2 calendar days before the Key Date.
A1 Integer Actual minutes of therapy recorded 1 calendar days before the Key Date.
A0 Integer Actual minutes of therapy recorded on the Key Date. Mutually exclusive with P0.
P0 Integer Planned minutes of therapy for the Key Date. Mutually exclusive with A0.
P1 Integer Planned minutes of therapy for 1 calendar day after the Key Date.
P2 Integer Planned minutes of therapy for 2 calendar day after the Key Date.
P3 Integer Planned minutes of therapy for 3 calendar day after the Key Date.
P4 Integer Planned minutes of therapy for 4 calendar day after the Key Date.
P5 Integer Planned minutes of therapy for 5 calendar day after the Key Date.
P6 Integer Planned minutes of therapy for 6 calendar day after the Key Date.
P7 Integer Planned minutes of therapy for 7 calendar day after the Key Date.
P8 Integer Planned minutes of therapy for 8 calendar day after the Key Date.
P9 Integer Planned minutes of therapy for 9 calendar day after the Key Date.
P10 Integer Planned minutes of therapy for 10 calendar day after the Key Date.
P11 Integer Planned minutes of therapy for 11 calendar day after the Key Date.
P12 Integer Planned minutes of therapy for 12 calendar day after the Key Date.
P13 Integer Planned minutes of therapy for 13 calendar day after the Key Date.
P14 Integer Planned minutes of therapy for 14 calendar day after the Key Date.
For all keys, the field cannot be blank (null). If there are no minutes to record, the field should not be left blank (null); instead, the key should store a 0 (zero).

bloodPressure.description: Unit of measure used by the facility for Blood Pressure. The unit is always mmHg regardless of the facility's Unit of Measure configuration.

heartRate.description: Unit of measure used by the facility for Heart Rate. The unit is always bpm regardless of the facility's Unit of Measure configuration.

oxygenSaturation.description: Unit of measure used by the facility for the Oxygen Saturation. The unit is always % regardless of the facility's Unit of Measure configuration.

respirations.description: Unit of measure used by the facility for Respirations. The unit is always Breaths/min regardless of the facility's Unit of Measure configuration.

temperature.description: Unit of measure used by the facility for Temperature. The unit is F for facilities using Imperial units, and C for facilities using Metric units.

weight.description: Unit of measure used by the facility for Weight. The unit is lbs for facilities using Imperial units, and Kg for facilities using Metric units.

showProgressNoteOn24HourReport.description: Determines whether or not the progress note should show on the 24Hr shift report.

signature.description: Determines whether a signature is required when documenting the administration of an order and if so, what kind of signature. Possible values are: none, password, 2-factor.

usePharmacyDirections.description: Determines whether the facility is using Pharmacy Directions instead of the PointClickCare generated orders directions.

pdmpEnabled.description:
Indicates if PDMP is enabled. The flag is true on the following conditions:
  • user has Vendor Protocol PDMP enabled;
  • user has CreateOrder and ConfirmOwnPhysOrder access;
  • user is a medical professional or is tied to a medical professional.

quantityAndRefillRequired.description: Indicates whether the quantity and refill are required for order creation.

dischargeOrderEnabled.description: Indicates whether the discharge order is enabled.

oneSignatureEnabled.description: Indicates whether the one signature is enabled.

oneReviewEnabled.description: Indicates whether the one review is enabled.

phone.description: The phone number of the facility, if available.

pickList.description: PointClickCare provides the ability for facilities to create custom pick lists for common sets of reference data. They are used to show a list items on the UI controls that the user can 'pick' from when entering data. For example, a facility is able to customize a martial status picklist such that when creating a patient the user may only pick from list of approved values. The pick list values themselves are free-form text fields and at this time are not locale specific and case sensitivity is not important. There is no meaning associated with the ordering of the pick list values.

censusActionCode.description: Represents the list of values configured for Census Action Codes by the facility. Values that can be selected for Census Action Codes are configurable at a facility level in PointClickCare.

actionCode.description: Represents the short code associated to the action type for the ADT record. PointClickCare allows facilities to configure a value for the action code up to 5 characters long.

actionType.description: Represents the action type associated to the ADT record. The action types are configurable at a facility level in PointClickCare. This means that the value of this field may vary from facility to facility. Each facility defined action type is however mapped to a standard action type.

id.description: Unique identifier for the pick list value for action.

standardActionType.description:
Represents the standard action type associated to the action type. PointClickCare allows facilities to define custom action types. Each custom action type is mapped to a standard action type. Possible values for this field are:
  • Admission
  • Death
  • Discharge
  • Internal Transfer
  • Leave
  • Return From Leave
  • Room Reserve

bloodPressure.description: Unit of measure used by the facility for Blood Pressure. The unit is always mmHg regardless of the facility's Unit of Measure configuration.

height.description: Unit of measure used by the facility for the Height. The default unit is inches for facilities using Imperial units and cm for facilities using Metric units.

oxygenSaturation.description: Unit of measure used by the facility for the Oxygen Saturation. The unit is always % regardless of the facility's Unit of Measure configuration.

respirations.description: Unit of measure used by the facility for Respirations. The unit is always Breaths/min regardless of the facility's Unit of Measure configuration.

temperature.description: Unit of measure used by the facility for Temperature. The unit is F for facilities using Imperial units, and C for facilities using Metric units.

weight.description: Unit of measure used by the facility for Weight. The unit is lbs for facilities using Imperial units, and Kg for facilities using Metric units.

rrule.description:
Defines a rule or repeating pattern for recurring events, based on RFC 5545 published by the IETF. Only one rrule is allowed per event. If an rrule is specified, it must consist of:
  • FREQ
  • INTERVAL
  • BYDAY
  • COUNT or UNTIL
A sample structure is "FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2;BYDAY=SU;UNTIL=2016-12-30".
The structure lists FREQ first.
Note: Occurrences are supported for a maximum span of 1 year from the startDateTime of the event.
Note: PointClickCare currently only supports Daily & Weekly schedules. If details about a Monthly or Yearly recurring event are being requested, the following string will be returned in the rrule:
"Recurrence Rule Not Supported for Monthly or Yearly events."
Note: No rrule will be returned for a non recurring event.
FREQ (string): The type of recurrence rule. Supported values are 'DAILY' and 'WEEKLY'.
UNTIL (date): Date value (YYYY:MM:DD) at which recurrence should end. This can not be passed together with COUNT.
COUNT (integer): Number of occurrences of the recurring event. Allowed values are between 1 and 53 inclusive for weekly events, and between 1 and 366 inclusive for daily events. This field can not be passed together with UNTIL.
INTERVAL (integer): A positive integer representing the interval between the occurrences of the event. Allowed values are between 1 and 53 for weekly events and between 1 and 366 for daily events.
BYDAY (string): List of days of the week. Allowed values are MO, TU, WE, TH, FR, SA and SU.Values are separated by a COMMA character (US-ASCII decimal 44). This field can not be used when FREQ is 'DAILY'.

startDateTime.description: Start date & time of the event. This field will always be returned.

errors.description: Indicates that claim batch status update has errors on vendor side. PointClickCare Application System is going to update corresponding claim batch status accordingly.

ClaimBatchStatusChangeErrors.title: ClaimBatchStatusChangeErrors

ClaimBatchStatusChangeError.description: Claim Batch Status Update Errors' code and description

code.description: The error code for the claim batch status. Possible error codes are 1151 and 1152.

description.description: The description for the error code contains the description of the code followed by a ":" and claim identifiers comma separated. Corresponding description for 1151 is "Duplicate CLM01 crosswalk identifier" and corresponding description for 1152 is "Invalid CLM01 identifier". This description is followed by a ":" and 16 characters claim identifiers comma separated.

ClaimBatchStatusChangeError.title: ClaimBatchStatusChangeError

outliers.description:
Represents if the patient has no known allergies or if the allergies for the patient are yet to be determined. Possible values are 'No Known Allergies' or 'To Be Determined'.

Note: If this field is provided, the allergy object is not required and should not be provided.

InboundAllergyData.description:
Represents the allergy.

Note: If allergy is provided, 'outliers' field is not required and should not be provided.

category.description:
Represents the category the allergy falls under. Acceptable values are 'Drug', 'Food', 'Environmental', 'Substance' and 'Other'.

If 'Other' category is selected, any alternative allergen system, code, and description can be included.

Note: If allergy object is provided, this field is required.

clinicalStatus.description:
Represents the allergy status. Acceptable values are: 'active', 'priorHistory', or 'resolved'.

Note: If allergy object is provided, this field is required.

onsetDate.description: Represents the date when the allergy was identified. The date is expressed as YYYY-MM-DD.

reactionNote.description: Free text notes associated to the allergy entered by the user. There is no size limit for the reactionNote.

reactionSubType.description:
Represents the reaction sub type. Each reaction type can have its own sub type.

Reaction sub type for 'Anaphylaxis'
  • Bronchospasm
  • Hypotension
  • Laryngeal edema
Reaction sub type for 'Cutaneous reactions'
  • Contact sensitivity
  • Erythema multiforme
  • Erythema nodosum
  • Exfoliative dermatitis
  • Fixed drug eruption
  • Maculopapular (morbilliform) rash
  • Pruritus
  • Stevens-Johnson syndrome
  • Toxic epidermal necrolysis
  • Urticaria and angioedema
  • Vasculitis
Reaction sub type for 'Hepatic reactions'
  • Cholestatic reactions
  • Hepatocellular damage
Reaction sub type for 'Photosensitivity reactions'
  • Destruction of formed elements of blood
  • Hemolytic anemia
  • Neutropenia
  • Thrombocytopenia
Reaction sub type for 'Pulmonary reactions'
  • Edema
  • Fibrosis
  • Interstitial or alveolar pneumonitis
Reaction sub type for 'Renal reactions'
  • Glomerulonephritis
  • Interstitial nephritis
  • Nephrotic syndrome

reactionType.description:
Represents the reaction type. Acceptable values in PointClickCare are:
  • Anaphylaxis
  • Cutaneous reactions
  • Drug Fever
  • Hepatic reactions
  • Lymphadenopathy
  • Nausea
  • Photosensitivity reactions
  • Pulmonary reactions
  • Renal reactions
  • Serum sickness
  • System vasculitis

recorder.description:
Individual who recorded the allergy and takes responsibility for its content.

Maximum 50 characters.

resolvedDate.description:
Represents the date when the allergy was resolved. The date is expressed as YYYY-MM-DD.

Note: If clinicalStatus is selected as 'resolved', resolvedDate is required.

severity.description: Represents the severity of the allergy for the patient. Acceptable values are, 'Mild', 'Moderate', 'Severe' or 'Unknown'.

type.description:
Represents the allergy type. Acceptable values are, 'Allergy', 'Intolerance', 'Propensity to Adverse Reactions' or 'Unknown'.

Note: If allergy object is provided, this field is required.

InboundAllergyData.title: InboundAllergyData

InboundAllergyDataAllergen.description:
Represents the allergen.

Note: If allergy object is provided, this field is required.

Specific code for the allergen.

Note: If allergy object is provided either code and system must both be provided, or neither can be provided.

Maximum 50 characters.

display.description:
Text description of the allergen.

Note: If allergy object is provided, this field is required.

Maximum 500 characters.

system.description:
Type of coding system being used. Can be a URL.

Current supported systems in PointClickCare:
  • Medispan Allergy Class
  • Medispan Ingredient ID
  • http://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm
  • http://hl7.org/fhir/ndfrt
  • http://snomed.info/sct
  • Custom
  • None
Note: If 'Other' category is selected, a URL is required.

Note: If allergy object is provided either code and system must both be provided, or neither can be provided.

Maximum 500 characters.

socialBeneficiaryIdentifier.description: The patient's Social Security Number (SSN) for US facilities or Social Insurance Number (SIN) for Canadian facilities. PointClickCare allows facilities to define their own format for the resident identifiers. Facilities can only use spaces, hyphens ("-") and dots (".") as separators. The value returned in the response includes the separators. SSN is not returned by default for production apps. Please contact your Partnership Manager and submit a business use case to request this.

glAccountNumber.description: Represents the GL Account Number. Entries for Dollar Amounts or Days are summarized by GL Account Number.  This value is configured by the customer and may not be unique across customers.

consolidationAccountNumber.description: Represents the Consolidation Account Number. Consolidation Account Number will be included if configured by the customer.  This value is configured by the customer and may not be unique across customers.

amount.description: Represents the total dollar amount for a given account number and journal entry type combination. Amount will be populated for all entries, except Days, which will be represented as Days. Amount will not include commas and will include digits (within unicode range 00030 through 00039) with a dot separator (full stop character with unicode 0002E) for cents where cents is at most 2 levels of precision. Negative amounts will be preceded by a minus character (unicode 0002D).

currency.description: The ISO 4217 3 letter code for the currency of the journal entry monetary amount. (Examples are USD for United States Dollar, CAD for Canadian Dollar).

days.description: Represents the total number of days for a given account number and journal entry type combination. This field will be populated only for Current Period - Days (DC) and Past Period - Days (DP) entries.

companyCode.description: Represents the unique identifier assigned to a business unit within a larger organization. Company code will be included if configured by customer.

costCenterCode.description: Represents the code associated with the Facility's Cost Center. Cost Center Code will be included if configured by customer.

However, the following formats are allowed as well. For 7 digits use 123-4567. For 8 digits, use 1234-5678. For 10 digits, use (123) 456-7890. For 11 digits, use (123) 4567-8901. For 12 digits, use (123) 45-67-89-012. For 14 digits, use (123) 45-67-89-01-234. For 15 digits, use (123) 45-6789-012345.

abnormalCode.description:
Abnormal code of observation result. Possible values are:

  • HH - Above upper panic limits
  • A - Abnormal - non numeric
  • AA - Very Abnormal - non numeric
  • BL - Below lowest instrument scale
  • AH - Above highest instrument scale
  • U - Significant change up
  • D - Significant change down
  • B - Better
  • W - Worse
  • I - Intermediate
  • MS - Moderately Susceptible
  • R - Resistant
  • S - Susceptible
  • VS - Very Susceptible

When a patient is admitted to a facility within an organization, they are assigned a patientId which is unique to their stay within that facility. If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. schedules.description: List of schedules for this medication.

startDate.description: The earliest administration date and time scheduled for this medication. Date and time are expressed in UTC (Coordinated Universal Time), with a special UTC designator ("Z").

status.description:
After the medication is created and has passed all reviews, it becomes "ACTIVE"
If the administration of the medication has been suspended, it becomes "ONHOLD"
If the administration of the medication has finished in its course, by schedule, it becomes "COMPLETED"
If the administration of the medication has finished by manual intervention, it becomes "DISCONTINUED"
If the newly created medication needs to be confirmed by a doctor, it becomes "UNCONFIRMED"
If the newly created medication needs to be reviewed by a doctor, it becomes "PENDING_REVIEW"
Certain classes of newly created medications (e.g. narcotics) may require doctor signature before becoming active. Until then, they stay as "PENDING_SIGNATURE"
Certain classes of newly created medications (e.g. narcotics) may require a two-step process to get doctor's signature before becoming active. Before the first phase is complete, they stay as "PENDING_MARK_TO_SIGN".

additionalDirections.description:
Free text field to capture any additional directions associated with the schedule description.
Note: Limit of 200 characters.

alternateFrequency.description: Frequencies not included in the PointClickCare list. Only used if 'Other' is passed as the frequency.

alternateScheduleType.description: Medication administration schedule types not included in the PointClickCare list. Only used if 'Other' is passed as the schedule type.

applyTo.description:
Indicates location of topical application. Limit of 25 characters.
Note: If the administration route is set to 'topically' this field is required.

dose.description:
The quantity of the medication.
Note: This should be a numeric value. Limit of 6 characters, including the decimal point (if value is a decimal).
Note: If the administration.route is set to 'topically', this field should not be used.
Note: Dose is only accepted, if the request does not include a dose min and max.

doseMax.description:
The maximum acceptable value for the prescribed medication dose range. This should be a numerical value. Limit of 6 characters, including the decimal point (if value is a decimal).
Note: If a dose maximum is supplied, a dose minimum is required.

doseMin.description:
The minimum acceptable value for the prescribed medication dose range. This should be a numerical value. Limit of 6 characters, including the decimal point (if value is a decimal).
Note: There is a minimum value of 0.
Note: If a dose minimum is supplied, a dose maximum is required.

Date & time when administration of the medication ended/should end. If this is blank, it will be assumed the medication has to continue indefinitely.

indicationsForUse.description: Indications for which medication was administered. Limit of 60 characters.

isPrnWithDirections.description:
Supported values are True/False.
Note: If the Schedule is 'PRN', this field is required. Either a True/False value must always be passed. If the value is set to 'False', the prnTimingValue and prnTiming fields must be used.
Note: If this field is set to 'True', additionalDirections must be used to send details of Frequency of Administration.

medicationRelatedDiagnoses.description: List of diagnosis associated with medication.

prnTiming.description:
Supported values are 'Hours' or 'Minutes'.
Note: If the Schedule is 'PRN', this field is applicable.
Note: With a PRN schedule, if isPrnWithDirections is not used, prnTiming must be used.

prnTimingValue.description:
If prnTiming is 'Hours', allowed values are 1 to 168 (equates to 7 days).
If prnTiming is Minutes, allowed values are 1 to 10080 (equates to 7 days).
Note: If the schedule is 'PRN', this field is applicable.
Note: With a PRN schedule, if isPrnWithDirections is not used, prnTimingValue must be used.

schedule.description:
Type of schedule to be followed for the medication. Supported schedules are:
  • Routine - A recurring schedule of administration of the medication.
  • PRN - Pro Re Nata - Medication to be administered as needed.
  • One Time Only - A one time administration of the medication.
  • Titration - A schedule with varying dosages. There must be more than one and they must be passed in order from the first to last Titration schedule. The limit is 15 Titration schedules.
  • STAT - Post incident record of the administration of a medication.
Note: If Schedule details are being sent, this field is required.

scheduleType.description:
Predefined list of possible medication administration schedule types from PointClickCare.
PointClickCare supported schedule types are listed below:
  • Everyday
  • Odd Days
  • Even Days
  • Every Other Day
  • Other

Note: If the schedule is 'Routine' or 'Titration', this field is required.

sequenceNumber.description: Unique Titration identifier. Required if Titration schedule is being sent.

startDateTime.description:
Date & time when administration of the medication commenced.
Note: If the Schedule is 'Titration', this field has to be later than the endDateTime of the prior Titration Schedule.

patientId.description: PointClickCare's unique identifier for a patient within the organization.</br></br>When a patient is admitted to a facility within an organization, they are assigned a patientId which is unique to their stay within that facility. If the same patient were to get admitted to another facility within the same organization in the future, they would be assigned a new patientId. The patientId however is unique at the organization level. That is, no two patients across different facilities within the organization will have the same patientId.

type.description: Represents the type of observation. For pushing a Pain Level observation, the acceptable value for this field is 'painLevel'.

bodyLanguage.description:
PAINAD pain level score for Body Language. Value must be in range of 0-2. This field is only applicable and is required when a PAINAD method is provided.
  • 0 - Relaxed.
  • 1 - Tensed, Distressed Pacing.
  • 2 - Rigid, Fists Clenched, Knees Pulled Up, Pulling or Pushing Away, Striking Out.

breathing.description:
PAINAD pain level score for Breathing. Value must be in range of 0-2. This field is only applicable and is required when a PAINAD method is provided.
  • 0 - Normal.
  • 1 - Occasional Laboured Breathing. Short Period of Hyperventilation.
  • 2 - Noisy Laboured Breathing. Long Period of Hyperventilation. Cheyne Stokes Respiration.

consolability.description:
PAINAD pain level score for Consolability. Value must be in range of 0-2. This field is only applicable and is required when a PAINAD method is provided.
  • 0 - No Need to Console.
  • 1 - Distracted or Reassured by Voice or Touch.
  • 2 - Unable to Console, Distract or Reassure.

facialExpression.description:
PAINAD pain level score for Facial Expression. Value must be in range of 0-2. This field is only applicable and is requiredwhen a PAINADmethod is provided.
  • 0 - Smiling or Inexpressive.
  • 1 - Sad, Frightened, Frown.
  • 2 - Facial Grimacing.

method.description: Represents the pain scale used to record the Pain Level. Possible values are 'Numerical' or 'PAINAD'.

negativeVocalization.description:
PAINAD pain level score for Negative Vocalization. Value must be in range of 0-2. This field is only applicable and is requiredwhen a PAINADmethod is provided.
  • 0 - None.
  • 1 - Occasional Moan or Groan. Low Level of Speech with a Negative Quality.
  • 2 - Repeated Troubled Calling Out. Loud Moaning or Groaning. Crying.
